page.title: 03FOSSE WAY, near OFFCHURCH.
page.content: The{Fosse Way}is designed for fast moving traffic, and is provided with convenient parking laybys at frequent intervals. { A traffic survey}showed that approximately sixty vehicles, the majority of which were private and commercial, pass along this route within a fifteen minute time limit. The road is kerbed in sections, fenced and hedged,with gorse bushes on the higher slopes. The wide verges are used for horse riding. { Plant life}of the verges includes daisies, buttercups, nettles, vetch, dandelions, hemlock, cow parsley, poppies, burdock and clover. { { Oak}and{ash}form the predominent tree life, and{wood pigeon}are abundant. Evidence of{hedgehogs, voles {and}squirrels can be found.
